decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Three year time limit

The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
Condition : 2 - In accordance with approved drawings

The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with:
Documents received on 24/07/2024
GSK-HTL-ZZ-00-DR-A-09010 Rev P3 (Existing Site Location Plan); GSK-HTL-ZZ-00-DR-A-09011 Rev P3 (Existing Block Plan)
Documents received on 29/07/2024
Cover letter by Turley, dated: 24 July 2024
Documents received on 30/09/2024
GSK-HTL-Z1-ZZ-DR-A-09300 Rev P4 (Proposed Hoarding Elevation); GSK-HTL-ZZ-00-DR-A-09100 Rev P5 (Proposed Site Hoarding Plan); 24-006-HW-0028 Rev A (Junction 3 Swept Path Analysis); Stage 1 Road Safety Audit, Ref: 2888-RSA-01 by CRS Capital Road Safety dated: Sept 2024
Reason: To ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission, a satisfactory standard of development is secured and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.
Condition : 3 - Materials

Notwithstanding any information given in the documents hereby approved, the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall be plywood material in blue.
Reason: In order that the Council may be satisfied as to the details of the development in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and protect living conditions, to satisfy the requirements of policies CC1 and CC2 of the adopted Local Plan.
Condition : 4 - Consent protect the General Public.

A.	Any hoarding panels erected and used principally shall be maintained in a condition that does not endanger the public.
B.	Graffiti should be removed in 5 working days.
Reason: In the interests of amenity and highway safety.
Condition : 5 - Advertisements

No advertisements are to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.
Reason: In order to comply with Regulation 2 of the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisement) (England) Regulations 2007.
Condition : 6 - Lighting 

Lighting along hoarding facing pavement and roads shall be designed, positioned and directed so as not to unnecessarily intrude on passing drivers or pedestrians or direct light into any neighbouring windows in accordance with the guidance provided by the Institute of Lighting Engineers Guidance Note: For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light 2021.
Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and in the interests of highway safety
Condition : 7 - Construction Hours

No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00 am to 6:00 pm on Mondays to Fridays and 9:00 am to 1:00 pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays and the Council may exercise its powers and penalties under environmental legislation to take enforcement action against developers who ignore this requirement.
Reason: In the interests of amenity.
Condition : 8 - Site Hoarding Strategy

Within six months of completion and prior to the installation of any displays on the approved hoarding, a 'Site Hoarding Strategy' shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The strategy shall confirm any final designs for continual displays on the site hoardings surrounding the Site, and shall be adhered to throughout the demolition and construction period; unless the written consent of the Local Planning Authority is received for any variation. 
Reason: In order that the advertisement be displayed in a manner that would not result in an unacceptable impact on public safety, in accordance with the intent of The Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) (England) Regulations 2007.
description: Erection of temporary hoardings measuring 3000mm x 1200mm for a period of 3 years and associated enabling works at 980 Great West Road, London.
subdivision_of_building: South, east and west elevations of the site.
